creditline: Collection of Roger Arvid Anderson in Honor of John Austin O'Keeffe
description: Plaque with left profile of Jules Bastien-Lepage; inscription at top
text:
Translated inscription: "Jules Bastien-Lepage, at 31 years of age, Paris, 1880 Augustus Saint-Gaudens made this." This portrait relief was one of Saint-Gaudens's favorites. He believed it to be near perfection because in it he had successfully expressed the sitter's singular combination of talent and vanity.

Bastien-Lepage was a leading painter of the anti-academic plein-air movement, which advocated the return to the depiction of nature as it is without preconceptions or idealization. These painters worked in the open air (plein air), portraying real people in everyday situations. Bastien-Lepage was at the height of his career when Saint-Gaudens made this relief in 1879, in return for a full-length portrait of himself by the painter (now lost).
title: Jules Bastien-Lepage
